Congratulations to Mexican President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Mexican President 
    Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Felipe Calderon Hinojosa on his assumption of office as president of Mexico.
 The message wished the president success in his responsible work for the country's stability and prosperity, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in the interests and desire of the two peoples.

articles.title: Congratulations to Mexican FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Mexican FM 
    Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Patricia Espinosa Cantellano on his appointment as secretary of Foreign Affairs of Mexico.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in conformity with the desire of the two peoples and on the principle of mutual respect, the message wished him success in his work.

Moves of S. Korean "Government" and Conservative Press under Fire
articles.content:
Moves of S. Korean "Government" and Conservative Press under Fire 
    Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Jang Song Hoe, chairman of the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon), reportedly released a statement on Nov. 28 to denounce the "government" and the conservative press for seeking to block the struggle against the conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement (FTA)".
 The "government" and the security authorities have launched a desperate suppression offensive after the "Nov. 22 all-people action" and the conservative press is keen on distorted propaganda, slandering the participants in the action as "rioters", the statement said.    
 Hanchongryon will put spurs to the struggle against the conclusion of the FTA together with the people, the statement said, demanding the "government" and the conservative press immediately stop negotiations for the conclusion of the unequal and disastrous FTA, not repeating the crimes committed during the military fascist dictatorship.

articles.title: Cuban Military Attache Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Cuban Military Attache Hosts Reception
    Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Miguel Angel Gala Valiente, military attache of the Cuban embassy here, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on Friday on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the Cuban revolutionary armed forces.
 Present there on invitation were Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Jon Hyon Chan, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and general officers and officers of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys and military attaches of different countries here.    
 Present there was Ruben Perez Valdes, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK.
 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Crackdown upon People's Just Actions under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Crackdown upon People's Just Actions under Fire
    Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of the Fatherland Friday issued a statement demanding the south Korean authorities immediately stop the suppression of the people and organizations opposed to the conclusion of the south-Korea-U.S. FTA and give up the U.S.-imposed negotiations. 
 It said:    
 The south Korean authorities are brutally cracking down upon the demonstrations staged by hundreds of thousands of people of all strata in different parts of south Korea including Seoul recently in protest against the negotiations for the conclusion of "FTA".
 Such fascist outrage is unpardonable suppression perpetrated by sycophantic traitors. 
 It is quite natural for the south Korean people to stage strikes, demonstrations, rallies and signature campaigns in protest against the negotiations for the conclusion of "FTA," terming it "a death sentence" against the south Korean economy," part of the U.S. strategy for domination" and the "second Ulsa Five-Point Treaty".  
 Nevertheless, the south Korean authorities are intensifying their fascist crackdown upon the above-said people at the point of bayonet, going against the desire of the popular masses. This more saliently reveals their unpopular and treacherous nature as they are utterly indifferent to the demands of the people and the interests of the nation, the statement concluded.

Housing Construction in Ryanggang Province
articles.content:
Housing Construction in Ryanggang Province
    Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- More than three thousand dwelling houses have been built in Ryanggang Province, the northern part of Korea.
 The houses are for those who were removed in connection with the construction of the Samsu Power Station and the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station.
 The villages are located on the shore of hydro-power station reservoirs and in beautiful and sunny places at the foot of mountains, each having scores of blocks.
 Each block for one or two families is well furnished with all furniture.
 While giving field guidance to the construction site of the Samsu Power Station in March, leader Kim Jong Il acquainted himself with the housing issue of the removed families. And he instructed officials that nation-wide assistance should be rendered to the housing construction there and construction forces and materials provided to it preferentially.    
 The Cabinet, ministries and national institutions took positive measures to provide construction forces and materials, with the result that the housing construction had been completed in a matter of several months.    
 The builders are making preparation for the second phase project following the completion of the first phase project.
